programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A home invasion and kidnapping lead the SVU to a shocking discovery; Muncy tries to fit in with the squad.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A young man asks the SVU for help when he suspects his boss is preying on his sister; Velasco tries to convince a reluctant witness to testify in court.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Rollins investigates an assault by a masked man at an underground party; Benson uncovers a suspect who may be valuable as a witness.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: When the case against a popular sports star falls through, Benson digs into the suspect's past to uncover additional victims; Velasco is disappointed when he meets one of his heroes.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The SVU hunts for a violent suspect who killed a detective's child; Rollins ponders a potential opportunity.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Carisi and Rollins work together on an important arraignment; Benson tries to make Noah's Christmas wish come true when a case falls in her lap.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: When Benson becomes the target of a ruthless gang leader, Capt. Duarte takes the case; Fin works with the Bronx SVU to help clear its case backlog; Lt. Dixon offers to translate when a deaf student is raped.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: While Benson tries to help the gang member who attacked her, Duarte reveals a shocking piece of evidence in the case; Fin is tasked with hiring new detectives for the Bronx SVU.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: As Benson and Carisi put a vengeful crime boss on trial, Fin tries to help a woman who was drugged and left for dead; Velasco takes drastic action to get information from a witness.

programme.title: The Listener
programme.desc: Toby rescues a woman who has been in a car accident and uses his abilities to solve a kidnapping.

programme.title: The Listener
programme.desc: Toby tracks down an arsonist after saving a childhood friend from a burning building.

programme.title: The Listener
programme.desc: Toby has visions of a missing girl after he bumps into a homeless man.

programme.title: The Listener
programme.desc: After Toby hooks up with a woman at a nightclub, she is found dead and he is a suspect in her murder.

programme.title: The Listener
programme.desc: When Toby saves a troubled teen from a gang beating, he stumbles upon a hidden group of runaways.

programme.title: The Listener
programme.desc: Toby tries to help the sister of a shooting victim find out who killed her brother.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: The team investigates a killing in which the crime scene points to a possible protege of Pelant; Angela second-guesses the decision to move to Paris; Brennan and Booth consider employment options.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Six months after starting a new life with her family, Brennan becomes interested in a case to which she has personal ties; an FBI investigation begins when Booth goes missing.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: When an infamous arms dealer is released from prison and bodies start piling up, Torres is forced to face the repercussions of his actions during an undercover operation he worked on years ago.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: NCIS investigates a ring of clever teenage partygoers when a string of break-ins takes place at Marine Base Quantico; while working the case, agent McGee forms a bond with one of the teens.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: NCIS investigates the unexpected death of a Navy reservist who was an investigative journalist; Knight and Jimmy's budding romance is put on hold when a vital organ transfer goes fatally wrong.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: When Parker is framed for murder, the team members puts their jobs and lives on the line to buy time and uncover the truth.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: With Special Agent Alden Parker still on the run with his ex-wife, the team investigates who from his past might have a personal vendetta against him in hopes of clearing Parker's name.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: McGee's personal life and professional life intersect when a dad from his children's school is linked to a break-in at a government storage bunker.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: When a dead body is found at an ancient burial site that is thought to be cursed, the team tries to determine the motive and the symbolism behind the crime; as Torres continues therapy with Dr. Grace, he discovers that their lives are in danger.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Agent Knight's past resurfaces when her ex-boyfriend, a National Parks Service agent, teams up with NCIS to investigate a campsite murder.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Agent Parker steps up to protect director Vance after a terrifying home invasion; the team detects advancements in Jessica and Jimmy's blossoming romance.

programme.title: What Would You Do?
programme.desc: Using hidden cameras, host John Quiñones observes and comments on how ordinary people behave when they are confronted with dilemmas that require them either to take action or to walk by and mind their own business. Various scenarios are created that force people to make split-second -- and often surprising -- decisions, and variations of the situation (such as changing the genders, races or clothing of the people involved) are often featured to see if different reactions are elicited. Examples of situations on the show include a waitress being harassed by her boss, and a drunken valet trying to park cars.

programme.title: RISING
programme.desc: Three of NASCAR’s Rising stars are thrown into the fire as they take on the most famous and dangerous track in America - Daytona to kick off the season. Go deep inside the lives of Rajah Caruth, Jesse Love, and Carson Hocevar as they prepare for the biggest race of the season. Who will triumph and who will crash and burn?

programme.title: RISING
programme.desc: After his disastrous day at Daytona, Carson Hocevar changes his tune and dazzles the NASCAR world with his aggression in Atlanta. Learn more about where Rajah Caruth comes from as well as his philosophy on the peaks and valleys of a NASCAR season. Jesse Love prepares for his NASCAR cup debut on the golf course with fellow driver Connor Zilisch.

programme.desc: All eyes are on the USA’s Rania Nasreddine, as she tries to make back-to-back European Poker Tour final tables. Brazilian pro Fabiano Kovalski is another previous EPT finalist looking for a second chance at victory. The top prize in this tournament is €1.5m. (9/11)

programme.title: The F Word
programme.desc: S03:E06 - The F Word

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc:
In tonight's final programme Gordon returns to Momma Cherri's Soul Food Shack, an intimate forty-seater in Brighton where he oversaw one of the most spectacular changes of fortune at a single venue. Owner CHARITA JONES was producing a menu of irresistible unique classics from the Deep South, but at the same facing financial disaster. The punters were missing, and so was her business acumen. But Gordon succeeded in shutting her out of the kitchen, getting the chef back on the boil and putting the soul back into the business.
Today Charita is fully-booked round the clock and bursting out of the Soul Shack to take on the 110-seater Momma Cherri's Big House. But expansion brings a different set of challenges, and she's still struggling to control her staff and manage her success. Has she got what it takes to make the next step up, or will she be forced to rethink her grand plans?

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: In tonight's penultimate programme Gordon returns to La Riviera - now renamed Abstract - a fine dining restaurant in Inverness. Owned by multi-millionaire Barry Larson and costing ~£8000 a week to run, the place boasted top French chef Loic Lefebvre and an impeccably-trained kitchen staff, all of them on a mission to bring sophisticated French cooking to the home of the haggis. But the locals weren't biting and the restaurant was empty most nights. Gordon's recipe for survival forced them to tone down their act and demystify the menu to get the punters in. Today the restaurant's return to form has led to plans for expansion. Loic is still there, and now he's been promoted to Executive Chef he will oversee any new ventures. But can he continue to resist a return to French frills, and has he managed to pull off his own personal ambition, a Michelin star?

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: Tonight, for the first time ever on Kitchen Nightmares, Gordon takes on a nightmare restaurant abroad. La Parra de Burriana is an ex-pat restaurant in Nerja on Spain's Costa del Sol. Nestling among the cafes lining the seafront offering all-day English breakfast and chips, La Parra is the brainchild of twenty-six-year-old ex-nightclub manager Laurence. He set himself up in business eighteen months ago with a loan from his dad and, although he's not an experienced chef, mans the kitchen on his own, determined to offer something better than chips to his largely British clientele.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: In tonight's second programme Gordon tackles a pub for the first time, getting to grips with The Fenwick Arms in rural Lancashire. The pub is run by landlord Brian who, after thirty years in the business and a quadruple heart-bypass, still puts in 120 hours a week and insists on laying down the law in the kitchen. Despite their best endeavours Brian and his partner Elaine are ~£250k in debt, losing ~1500 a week and facing bankruptcy within three months unless there's a drastic reversal in their fortunes.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels across the south west of the country to visit some of Britain's most exotic gardens. On this journey, Monty also goes to some of the country's most historic gardens, as well as some challenging contemporary ones.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: It's the Easter weekend, which means extra time to get out and enjoy the garden. At Longmeadow, Monty plants out sweet peas for summer colour, gives advice on what to use for mulching borders and has plenty of ideas for jobs to get on with this long weekend. Carol Klein is at RHS Rosemoor to revel in the floral spring sensations that epitomise the season. In Scotland, JJ Chalmers explains how important his local park was in helping both his physical and mental rehabilitation.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty harvests his loofahs, plants tulip bulbs in pots, gives a masterclass in making leafmould and reflects on the gardening year.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In the last programme of the current series, Monty Don takes stock of his year at Longmeadow. We visit RHS Wisley to learn why autumn leaves are such a precious commodity for our gardens, and in the final instalment of her botany series, Carol Klein celebrates the glorious displays put on by flowering plants to attract pollinators.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty plants a mix of white flowers in the writing garden, demonstrates how to prune a climbing rose and reviews what's been happening in the vegetable garden. Adam Frost celebrates seasonal colour on a visit to a garden in Essex, and Sue Kent pots up allium bulbs in readiness for spring and replants a tricky border with lavender she's grown from cuttings.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In the cottage garden, Monty is moving a rose which has outgrown its space and in the vegetable garden he gives advice on what to plant now for spring. He also finds out more about the mysterious world of earthworms and discovers why they are vital for the garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty's in the jewel garden showing which plants need protection from the elements now and which ones can be left until after the first frosts. He also plants out berried shrubs to help feed wildlife in the winter, harvests pumpkins and shows how to make use of fallen autumnal leaves.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gets involved in more seasonal tasks at Longmeadow. Carol Klein celebrates the spring highlights at Beth Chatto's Gardens in Essex, and Toby Buckland is in Cornwall to meet a gardener who fell out of love with gardening.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty tackles three seasons of gardening when he makes additions to his spring garden, gives advice on how to dry and preserve herbs for winter and plants up a container to give interest from now until spring. Carol celebrates one of the plant successes of an extraordinary summer, the Canna while Frances Tophill tackles a viewer's garden and suggests plants which will perform throughout the winter. Toby Buckland visits a garden in Devon with Japanese influences.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: This time there's plenty to do to prepare for the season to come and Monty Don is clearing out spent crops and mulching his asparagus. Joe Swift's been to visit keen gardeners, Wayne and Geraldine Hemingway, to see how they combine sustainability with their designer-style. Carol Klein's exploring the history of the rose at Coughton Court, one of our best rose gardens and Monty plants a new rose of his own. What happens when you have to downsize and leave your much-loved garden?

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Charge your glasses as Joe Swift visits a `drinkable' allotment in London where much of the produce is grown to make beer, wine and cider. In the first of a five-part series about botany, Carol Klein looks at the capsules of potential that herald the start and end of most plants' lives: seeds.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As autumn gathers momentum, it's time to start putting the garden to bed for winter. Monty Don has some timely advice on what to do. Carol Klein meets a nurseryman in Herefordshire and together they indulge in the beauty of the Japanese maple.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the clocks going forward this weekend, there's an extra hour of gardening to enjoy. Monty makes the most of this as he begins to sow dahlia seeds for summer flowers, reveals a new project and shows what to plant now in the vegetable garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With Bonfire Night in mind, Monty Don turns his attention to the firecracker colours of spring when he begins to tidy up his herbaceous plants to make room to plant tulip bulbs. As well as recommending varieties for an early display, he also shows what to plant now under the shade of trees for colour next year.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Frances Tophill and the team continue to celebrate the joy that the gardening year brings; Rachel de Thame visits Anglesey Abbey; Arit Anderson discovers how rewilding can increase biodiversity.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty welcomes spring at Longmeadow with plenty of changes in the garden to share. As well as getting on with some essential pruning, he lifts and divides perennials, starts sowing chillies and begins growing this year's vegetables.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost demonstrates how to build a rose arch, mulches his beds and plants a blackcurrant to train up a fence. Frances Tophill visits RHS Wisley in Surrey to witness the seasonal colour that heathers can provide in the winter months.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: After an extraordinary season, Monty's orchard has a bountiful harvest of apples and he gives advice on how to pick and store them. Frances Tophill makes a final visit to her shared allotment and joins in with the festivities at their annual show. Adam Frost visits the RHS garden Wisley where he meets the Curator to discuss the effects of summer. Nick Bailey investigates knotweed, one of the most pernicious weeds in the UK, Arit Anderson provides inspiration for colourful late season containers.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In the second of her films about botany, Carol Klein goes underground to unravel the mysteries of roots and why they are so important to the health of our plants. Joe Swift meets fashion icon, Dame Zandra Rhodes, to explore how the flowers she likes to grow have influenced her designs over the years.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty has tips and ideas for planting up garden pots to provide a focal point over the winter months, Rachel visits the tulips of Keukenhof, Joe visits Esther Rantzen's much-loved garden, and Carol visits Glebe Cottage.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty welcomes spring at Longmeadow with plenty of changes in the garden to share. As well as getting on with some essential pruning, he lifts and divides perennials, starts sowing chillies and begins growing this year's vegetables.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the winter draws to a close, work in the garden starts to step up gear. With the flowers and fruits of summer in mind, Monty Don gets going by planting pots of summer bulbs for colour and scent, passing on his secrets of success by using a variety of planting techniques. He also reveals plans for reinvigorating the area in his garden where perennials are planted. Plus, Carol Klein visits Glendurgan Garden in Cornwall.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With Halloween just round the corner, Monty Don is harvesting his pumpkins and showing how to store them for roasts, soups and stews in the coming months. Joe Swift visits a high end garden in West London to get some tips on how clever landscaping and the use of lighting can turn a small space into an outdoor room which can be used all year round.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is back at the helm, but this time in the garden at his own Herefordshire home - a place that he has lovingly nurtured for the last 20 years. With winter receding, Monty, Carol Klein, Joe Swift and Rachel de Thame are preparing for spring. As well as showing us round his garden, Monty lifts and divides snowdrops and sows beetroot and plants onions. Monty also prunes his apple trees and trims his shrub roses.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gives advice on the plants that need winter protection and thinks ahead to colourful spring bouquets. The glory of summer may be over in most gardens, but Carol goes to Worcestershire in search of some autumn colour.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty and the team focus their attention on the loss of wildflower habitats in the UK and the part that gardeners can play in averting the resulting loss of wildlife. Adam Frost is in Lincolnshire to find out how crucial meadows are to supporting an ecosystem.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don prepares for his spring display and tackles slippery paths, Carol Klein visits a collection of Michaelmas daisies and we visit a veg grower with a show-stopping Halloween pumpkin.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In the cottage garden, Monty is moving a rose which has outgrown its space and in the vegetable garden he gives advice on what to plant now for spring. He also finds out more about the mysterious world of earthworms and discovers why they are vital for the garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don takes some practical steps to protect tender plants as the first frosts of the year begin to bite. He also starts preparing for next spring, planting tulips, pansies and apple trees and sharing his advice on training step-over apples and planting out wallflowers from seed. Meanwhile, Carol Klein is at Glebe Cottage demonstrating how to grow plants from cuttings.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don prepares the flowering borders for winter and makes a bonfire, Carol celebrates our berry-laden hedgerows, and Rachel visits Julian Clary in his garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In the last programme of the current series, Monty Don takes stock of his year at Longmeadow. We visit RHS Wisley to learn why autumn leaves are such a precious commodity for our gardens, and in the final instalment of her botany series, Carol Klein celebrates the glorious displays put on by flowering plants to attract pollinators.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: We find out how Rachel de Thame got on over the past year as she attempted to grow her own cut flowers, and if you're still in a quandary about what to grow in your winter pots this year, Monty Don may well have the answer.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Realtree's crew of waterfowl hunters get together for their annual Louisiana duck hunt. Dr. Duck, Billy Campbell, Rusty Creasey, and Michael Pitts head down south to get on the ducks. There's a lot of ducks around, but they're playing hard to get. So, the guys have to get creative to make it happen.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson is known as the “Slam guy.” He has completed the North America and South America Waterfowl slams, each in a single season. After some thought and due diligence, Mark is now embarking on a journey to complete one of the most diverse slams there is, The New Zealand Wingshooting Slam. Mark starts this journey with his 828 U Benelli, going after turkey and quail.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson continues his hunt in Mexico for a Mexican Texanus Whitetail. On day one, Mark connected with a great management buck, making this buck the first Mexican Texanus Whitetail with his rifle. As temperatures drop and bucks become more active each passing day, he eagerly anticipates an action-packed evening ahead.

programme.title: Operation Healing Heroes
programme.desc: U.S. Navy veteran John Fleming recounts the life altering effects of his traumatic brain injury which cost him his rank.

programme.title: Sail Kings
programme.desc: What starts as a normal trip turns wild as Capt. Jared and Capt. Garrett get swarmed by Cobia.

programme.title: Sail Kings
programme.desc: The sharks won’t stop Capt. Jared and special Guest Capt. Jimmy Hendricks from having their day.

programme.title: Sail Kings
programme.desc: Capt. Jared and Capt. Jake Leon hop in the bay boat in search of a back country slam.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Overview: Across the country, deer season to many Americans is a rite of passage. For generations, Winchester has been the trusted ammunition choice for hunters…and it’s been a decade since the game-changing Deer Season XP whitetail line was introduced. In this episode, we’ll celebrate the many successes by Team Winchester hunters in the field during whitetail and mule deer firearm seasons across the United States. GUESTS: Melissa Bachman (Team Winchester) Mark Drury (Team Winchester) Nikki Boxler (Team Winchester) Chris Keefer (Team Winchester) Casey Keefer (Team Winchester) Jason Gilbertson (Team Winchester)

programme.title: Behind The Draw
programme.desc: Chandler is kicking season off in KS during the early season and has to get creative to pull it off from the ground! He's familiar with the "Narrow 10" after having a great encounter with him 2 years prior. Closing this story on the Schumacher's farm was a special one with the ground strategy we put together!

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: The 2024 turkey season has arrived. Slade and Bentley are already off to a great start. Bentley managed to take one down opening weekend for youth hunt. And Slade took one down opening day. This episode features an inside look into Slade’s life filled with real eastate and the great outdoors.
Chris Schmidt and his son Hunter go after some big east coast bucks and a whopper of a bruin before closing out the season in Kansas.

programme.title: The Hunted Land & Sea
programme.desc: Gerry Holland reflects on his first trip to Africa with Kristian and Kim Hansen. Expecting the unexpected on a trip around the world with tumbling bullets and lethal snakes.

programme.title: Canadian Whitetail
programme.desc: A massive heavy old buck disappears and re-appears leaving many questions and a year of trying to get an encounter.

programme.title: Huntstand Presents
programme.desc: The West Texas desert has a way of pulling you in. In Desert Ghost, Will Cooper heads west to Marathon, Texas, with longtime friend and mentor Cody Roberts to hunt aoudad in one of the most remote landscapes in the state. Rooted in family legacy, this film explores Cody’s deep ties to the desert, the story behind Desert Ghost Distillery, and the mystique of a western oasis near Big Bend National Park. More than a hunt, Desert Ghost dives into the role of aoudad management and its importance to desert bighorn sheep conservation efforts led by Texas Parks and Wildlife and the Wild Sheep Foundation. Sometimes, to protect what belongs here — you have to chase the ghosts. You really do have to be tough, determined, or one lucky bastard to make it out in West Texas.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Colten & Mark Scroggins is in Oklahoma during the peak rut, chasing mature whitetail bucks! With bucks on the move and searching for does, it's the perfect time to break out the calls. Watch as Mark and Colten pull out all the stops—getting aggressively loud with the WoodHaven "Intimidator" Grunt Call—to turn a cruising buck and bring him right into bow range at the blind.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Mike Pentecost sets up a new stand on a creek crossing in Illinois that had been scouted for the past two years. It always heated up as the season progressed, and on his very first morning sit, the action unfolded fast. A good buck came cruising from the South in search of a doe. At 60 yards he started to turn away, but the Intimidator grunt call changed everything. With a few calls from the Intimidator, he spun around from 150 yards, worked a scrape at 40 yards, and walked right into range!

programme.title: The Bearded Buck
programme.desc: Juggling school and hunting puts Austin in a time crunch. As he is finishing up his fourth and final year of college, he is also concentrating on putting down the Big Nine.

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.desc: Establishing themselves just after the last Ice Age, the blacktail of Vancouver Island offers an important genetic population isolated from the mainland. To explore the local relationship with the species, its harvesting, conservation and history, Dan Cabela travels to the island.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green and Jeff Hutchinson head to Maryland to bow-fish for an invasive, toothy fish called the snakehead. They learn how this fish, a native of Asia, made its way to the United States. They also learn from the locals, despite its appearance, it is one tasty fish.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green meets up with his friends at the National Wild Turkey Federation to dive into turkey conservation, and hunt the largest subspecies of wild turkey. Kyle finishes off this episode with his most favorite wild game recipe, boneless wild turkey wings.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle and Jeff team up with their friends from Boss Shotshells in South Dakota for a high-energy upland hunt, pursuing wild pheasants with the help of skilled hunting dogs. The adventure takes a quirky turn with a visit to the iconic Corn Palace.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: PCB’s white sand beaches are jam-packed with visitors soaking up sunand surf while Justin and Meredith chase schools of migrating tarponjust offshore. How often do those two worlds collide?

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: While releasing a defeated tarpon healthy after an epic battle is the ultimate victory, everything else is measured in heartbreak and degrees of failure. For Justin, putting Ethan on his first silver king requires patience and a tasty diversion by a local chef.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Meredith learns the value of the Trash Can Slam on a flounder trip withCapt. Justin that turns into a multi-species challenge.”

programme.desc: The sharks won’t stop Capt. Jared and special Guest Capt. Jimmy Hendricks from having their day.

programme.title: Sail Kings
programme.desc: Capt. Jared and Capt. Jake Leon hop in the bay boat in search of a back country slam.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Overview: Across the country, deer season to many Americans is a rite of passage. For generations, Winchester has been the trusted ammunition choice for hunters…and it’s been a decade since the game-changing Deer Season XP whitetail line was introduced. In this episode, we’ll celebrate the many successes by Team Winchester hunters in the field during whitetail and mule deer firearm seasons across the United States. GUESTS: Melissa Bachman (Team Winchester) Mark Drury (Team Winchester) Nikki Boxler (Team Winchester) Chris Keefer (Team Winchester) Casey Keefer (Team Winchester) Jason Gilbertson (Team Winchester)

programme.title: Behind The Draw
programme.desc: Chandler is kicking season off in KS during the early season and has to get creative to pull it off from the ground! He's familiar with the "Narrow 10" after having a great encounter with him 2 years prior. Closing this story on the Schumacher's farm was a special one with the ground strategy we put together!

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: The 2024 turkey season has arrived. Slade and Bentley are already off to a great start. Bentley managed to take one down opening weekend for youth hunt. And Slade took one down opening day. This episode features an inside look into Slade’s life filled with real eastate and the great outdoors.
Chris Schmidt and his son Hunter go after some big east coast bucks and a whopper of a bruin before closing out the season in Kansas.

programme.title: The Hunted Land & Sea
programme.desc: Gerry Holland reflects on his first trip to Africa with Kristian and Kim Hansen. Expecting the unexpected on a trip around the world with tumbling bullets and lethal snakes.

programme.title: Canadian Whitetail
programme.desc: A massive heavy old buck disappears and re-appears leaving many questions and a year of trying to get an encounter.

programme.title: Huntstand Presents
programme.desc: The West Texas desert has a way of pulling you in. In Desert Ghost, Will Cooper heads west to Marathon, Texas, with longtime friend and mentor Cody Roberts to hunt aoudad in one of the most remote landscapes in the state. Rooted in family legacy, this film explores Cody’s deep ties to the desert, the story behind Desert Ghost Distillery, and the mystique of a western oasis near Big Bend National Park. More than a hunt, Desert Ghost dives into the role of aoudad management and its importance to desert bighorn sheep conservation efforts led by Texas Parks and Wildlife and the Wild Sheep Foundation. Sometimes, to protect what belongs here — you have to chase the ghosts. You really do have to be tough, determined, or one lucky bastard to make it out in West Texas.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Colten & Mark Scroggins is in Oklahoma during the peak rut, chasing mature whitetail bucks! With bucks on the move and searching for does, it's the perfect time to break out the calls. Watch as Mark and Colten pull out all the stops—getting aggressively loud with the WoodHaven "Intimidator" Grunt Call—to turn a cruising buck and bring him right into bow range at the blind.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Mike Pentecost sets up a new stand on a creek crossing in Illinois that had been scouted for the past two years. It always heated up as the season progressed, and on his very first morning sit, the action unfolded fast. A good buck came cruising from the South in search of a doe. At 60 yards he started to turn away, but the Intimidator grunt call changed everything. With a few calls from the Intimidator, he spun around from 150 yards, worked a scrape at 40 yards, and walked right into range!

programme.title: The Bearded Buck
programme.desc: Juggling school and hunting puts Austin in a time crunch. As he is finishing up his fourth and final year of college, he is also concentrating on putting down the Big Nine.

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.desc: Establishing themselves just after the last Ice Age, the blacktail of Vancouver Island offers an important genetic population isolated from the mainland. To explore the local relationship with the species, its harvesting, conservation and history, Dan Cabela travels to the island.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green and Jeff Hutchinson head to Maryland to bow-fish for an invasive, toothy fish called the snakehead. They learn how this fish, a native of Asia, made its way to the United States. They also learn from the locals, despite its appearance, it is one tasty fish.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green meets up with his friends at the National Wild Turkey Federation to dive into turkey conservation, and hunt the largest subspecies of wild turkey. Kyle finishes off this episode with his most favorite wild game recipe, boneless wild turkey wings.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle and Jeff team up with their friends from Boss Shotshells in South Dakota for a high-energy upland hunt, pursuing wild pheasants with the help of skilled hunting dogs. The adventure takes a quirky turn with a visit to the iconic Corn Palace.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: PCB’s white sand beaches are jam-packed with visitors soaking up sunand surf while Justin and Meredith chase schools of migrating tarponjust offshore. How often do those two worlds collide?

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: While releasing a defeated tarpon healthy after an epic battle is the ultimate victory, everything else is measured in heartbreak and degrees of failure. For Justin, putting Ethan on his first silver king requires patience and a tasty diversion by a local chef.

programme.desc: Kathleen is an overworked public defender who needs a vacation. Instead, she is given another case with no ordinary crime and no ordinary criminal.

programme.title: Home Invasion
programme.desc: A botched robbery turns into a hostage crisis as a gang of armed criminals holds a woman and four children captive while police surround the house.

programme.title: Bad Country
programme.desc: Set in 1983, this is the tale of a Baton Rouge detective who uses an informant to infiltrate the most sinister criminal enterprise in the South.

programme.title: Untraceable
programme.desc: There has never been a cyber criminal they couldn't catch...until now...The more people who watch...the faster the victims die.

programme.title: Silverado
programme.desc: In the 1800s Old West, an unlikely band of misfit friends teams up in a shoot-em-up against a frontier town’s crooked sheriff and his henchmen.

programme.title: Stealth
programme.desc: Three of the world’s best pilots are partnered with a high-tech pilotless warplane, but soon it becomes clear that the machine has a mind of its own.

programme.title: Rudy
programme.desc: A big-hearted, working class teenager must overcome the odds in order to fulfill his dreams of playing football for Notre Dame.

programme.title: The Karate Kid
programme.desc: A teenager learns wisdom and self-control from an unorthodox karate master. With his new mentor's guidance, the boy faces down his fears.

programme.title: How to Save a Marriage and Ruin Your Life
programme.desc: A dedicated bachelor takes it upon himself to save his best friend’s marriage by seducing his mistress, only to wind up in his own romantic conundrum.

programme.title: Dr. Strangelove Or: How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love the Bomb
programme.desc: Based on Peter George's book "Red Alert."

programme.title: Anatomy of a Murder
programme.desc: Semi-retired Michigan lawyer Paul Biegler (James Stewart) takes the case of Army Lt. Manion (Ben Gazzara), who murdered a local innkeeper after his wife (Lee Remick) claimed that he raped her. Over the course of an extensive trial, Biegler parries with District Attorney Lodwick (Brooks West) and out-of-town prosecutor Claude Dancer (George C. Scott) to set his client free, but his case rests on the victim's mysterious business partner (Kathryn Grant), who's hiding a dark secret.

programme.title: Guess Who's Coming to Dinner
programme.desc: A daughter visits her family to introduce them to her Black fiancé, whose kindness and loving demeanor changes the hearts of her reluctant parents.

programme.title: The Heroes of Telemark
programme.desc: In German-occupied Norway in 1942, a resistance group attempts to sabotage the Nazi's production of essential atomic bomb components.

programme.title: Autumn Leaves
programme.desc: An aging, lonely spinster marries a good-looking younger man only to find that he has a very tormented past and is mentally disturbed.

programme.title: Where Angels Go...Trouble Follows
programme.desc: A bus trip for the girls of St. Francis Academy in Pennsylvania takes a radical detour on its way to an interfaith youth rally in California.

programme.title: Her Husband's Affairs
programme.desc: Advertising executive William Weldon (Franchot Tone) narrowly averts career implosion when his clever wife, Margaret (Lucille Ball), helps him save an important advertising account. But tensions run high in the Weldon household after William's fast-talking employer, J.B. Cruikshank (Edward Everett Horton), invites Margaret to work for him too. The cunning couple must compete with each other to write a campaign for Emil Glinka (Mikhail Rasumny) -- a mad scientist with an alarming new product.

programme.title: Run Wild, Run Free
programme.desc: A mute boy who spends his days roaming the English countryside starts coming out of his shell when he befriends a wild pony and a retired colonel.

programme.title: The Notorious Landlady
programme.desc: After falling for his charming landlady, an American diplomat in London learns that she's suspected of murder and tries to help her clear her name.

programme.title: The Wackiest Ship in the Army
programme.desc: During WW II, Lt. Rip Crandall and his inexperienced and motley crew get assigned to deliver an Australian observer to a Japanese-held island.

programme.title: It Happened One Night
programme.desc: When a brash reporter starts trailing a runaway heiress on her bus trip from Florida to New York for a big scoop, can love be far behind?

programme.title: Guess Who's Coming to Dinner
programme.desc: A daughter visits her family to introduce them to her Black fiancé, whose kindness and loving demeanor changes the hearts of her reluctant parents.

programme.title: The Man From Tumbleweeds
programme.desc: Ex-convict gunfighters join a state ranger (Bill Elliott) on patrol for outlaws.

programme.title: Buck and the Preacher
programme.desc: A trail guide who protects former slaves and a con-man join forces against bounty hunters hired to drive the former slaves back into the south.

programme.title: They Rode West
programme.desc: Dr. Allen Seward (Robert Francis) is the new doctor at a remote Army outpost. His liberal attitudes towards Native Americans become a source of tension between him and his superiors, especially Capt. Peter Blake (Philip Carey), who regards all Native Americans as dangerous and untrustworthy. Seward's insistence on treating several local Kiowa tribespeople for malaria further enrages Blake, who deems Seward a traitor when the Kiowa join forces with the Comanches and attack the fort.

programme.title: Apache Ambush
programme.desc: On a cattle drive to Kansas after the Civil War, an ex-Union soldier comes up against Apache and Confederate renegades.

programme.title: Ride Lonesome
programme.desc: A bounty hunter escorts a killer to prison but allows his outlaw brother to catch up with them to have a showdown over a previous shocking murder.

programme.title: South of Death Valley
programme.desc: The Durango Kid attempts to ease tensions between ranchers and miners over the cause of polluted water.

programme.title: Three Hours to Kill
programme.desc: The inhabitants of a small western community turn on Jim Guthrie (Dana Andrews) when he becomes the prime suspect for a murder he didn't commit. Before getting a chance to prove his innocence, Jim is driven from his home and into the wilderness, where he is left for dead. Despite the danger, he comes back years later, discovering that he's still a wanted man. But a kindhearted local named Chris (Dianne Foster) believes his story, and together they begin a desperate search for the true culprit.

programme.title: The White Squaw
programme.desc: A Swedish settler (David Brian) starts a war when he tries to drive Dakotas off their Wyoming reservation.

programme.title: The Parson and the Outlaw
programme.desc: Billy the Kid (Anthony Dexter) retires from the outlaw life, fakes his own death and adopts the name William Bonney. Soon, William runs into Jack Slade (Sonny Tufts), a gun-toting stranger who is itching for a gunfight. Jack falls in with a group of thugs terrorizing William's town. The Rev. Jericho Jones (Buddy Rogers) exhorts William to defend the townspeople, and, when William's maid, Tonya (Marie Windsor), is beaten by the thugs, he grabs his pistol.

programme.title: Go West, Young Lady
programme.desc: A vicious outlaw called Pecos Pete (Onslow Stevens) has long tormented the peaceful residents of a small frontier town. So these desperate people hire a dedicated new sheriff, Tex Miller (Glenn Ford), to bring this ruffian to justice. But, for all his determination, Tex is tricked by Pete and led into an ambush. Ultimately, it is the wily and brassy transplant Belinda "Bill" Pendergast (Penny Singleton) who uncovers Pete's true identity and plots a way to run him out of town once and for all.

programme.title: 40 Guns to Apache Pass
programme.desc: A cavalry captain (Audie Murphy) rescues settlers and catches a corporal (Kenneth Tobey) selling rifles to Apaches.

programme.title: The Fighting Frontiersman

programme.title: The Bandit of Zhobe
programme.desc: After Maj. Crowley (Norman Wooland) arrests the warrior Kasim Khan (Victor Mature) under suspicion of attacking British troops, Khan escapes. While he is away, a rival warlord, Azhad Khan, dresses his troops as British soldiers and attacks Kasim's village, killing his family. Thinking that the British are behind the attack, Kasim wages war against them. Only Crowley's daughter, Zena (Anne Aubrey), with help from her guard, Stokes (Anthony Newley), sees that Kasim is not the enemy.

programme.desc: Two brothers return home after the Civil War to find that their family has been kidnapped by a marauding band of rebel Confederate guerrillas.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny and the team take on a 1967 Caddy for a high end client, but will Ryan and Danny's plan to match the unique interior.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: The huge photo shoot day for the Count's Kustoms calendar is approaching.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny's friend Brian has always wanted to ride a motorcycle, but has never been able due to his physical limitations.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny gets started on a project that he's been waiting a long time to tackle, a 1971 Chevy C10 Pick Up. He plans to flip it for a big profit.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Kevin's brother is a judge, but that won't get him a free ride, and the guys struggle to finish his '62 Chevy pick-up within budget.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny is commissioned to custom paint a brand new pick-up for a charity auction for the local YMCA.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny is commissioned to restore a family heirloom '67 Ford Mustang.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny lets painter Ryan take the lead on a 1959 Chevy Panel Truck project he hopes to flip, and later motivates his crew to clean up the shop.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny conspires with a proud dad to give the ultimate surprise 16th birthday gift, and the shop frustrates a customer with a design error.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: On this hour-long episode Danny is doubly-blessed when a His and Hers restoration--a 1970 Plymouth Road Runner and a 1970 Dodge Coronet--are commissioned.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny and the boys give away a perfect hot rod at the annual Rockabilly Reunion at Lake Havasu. Later, a lady biker stuns the boys.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: The shop finally gets to work on Danny's famous '71 Super Fly Cadillac, but Kevin isn't feeling the love. Later, Grandpa wins big at poker but blows a deal for a new motorcycle.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: An eccentric couple wants to turn a 20 year-old ambulance into a ghost-hunting vehicle, which awakens a rogue spirit in the shop.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Get revved up when Danny spots a killer 1967 Pontiac GTO at one of the biggest car shows in Vegas.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny has wanted a Plymouth Roadrunner ever since a couple of car nuts pulled him over a few years ago, and bought his Sebring on the spot.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny and the Count's Kustoms crew rally together to help Shannon restore his father's long lost chopper. Meanwhile, Danny does a do-over on his customized 1990 Chevy Suburban.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny discovers the rarest Cadillac collection he's ever seen. Later, Horny Mike has 30 days to move his big ugly bus.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: When the World Series of Poker guys want a Count's Kustoms chopper as the ultimate online giveaway, Danny is determined to make it something special.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Former Guns & Roses guitarist DJ Ashba arrives at Count's Kustoms in a 2004 Lamborghini Murcielago that he wants turned into the ultimate "mancar".

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny looks at some of the most famous clients to walk through the doors at Count's Kustoms; Elvira, who needs a facelift for her infamous Macabre Mobile; Chumlee and the Lincoln Continental he wants to flip in true "Pawn Stars" fashion.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny wants to fix up and flip a 1978 Lincoln Continental Town Car. That is, if he can bring himself to let it go. Then, the crew transforms a 1954 Oldsmobile Rocket 88.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny is visited by legendary Mistress of the Dark, Elvira, whose famous Thunderbird is in need of some mechanical magic.

programme.desc: Danny and Horny Mike get too close for comfort when they convince a Model-T Hot Rod owner to let them take it for a spin. Later, a Soap Box race car brings out the inner child in Roli and Mike.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Industry titans Pihl Logging and Rygaard Logging tackle some of their most challenging jobs yet; Frank Harkness makes a name for himself; Buckin' Billy Ray takes to the treetops of Vancouver Island, risking his life to keep other people safe.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Mike Pihl looks for help from a logging legend; Jason Rygaard faces his biggest test as the new boss; the Harkness crew battles winter storms and vertical terrain in the Cascade Mountains; Wade Etienne goes after valuable hardwood giants.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Brandon Harkness fights his way up a mountainside; Mike Pihl get his 52-ton yarder lodged between trees; Wade Ettiene's Big Mama takes a two-inch steel sawtooth to her face; and Buckin' Billy's son Hogan loses his grip while cutting a tree.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Mike Papac has to step in as Joe and Coatsey's arguments threaten to bring the job to a grinding halt; David Zitterkopf's back to work after an injury that threatened to end his season.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: A storm's brewing over the Swamp Man and it's threatening to wash away his hopes of filling a huge order; Gabe deals with the aftermath of Aiden's mutiny; the Chapman crew's behind after they burned through their money chasing the Lost Logging Train.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: In Washington, three generations of Rygaard loggers are fighting for the crown; Papack Alaska Logging moves into their final section; Gary and Eddie see if their swamp logging gamble has paid off.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Papac Logging is barely holding onto their lead; the Rygaards will have to work as a team if they're gonna reclaim the title; Shelby Stanga's under the gun, but has a secret map to a possible stash of sunken logs.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Industry titans Pihl Logging and Rygaard Logging tackle some of their most challenging jobs yet; Frank Harkness makes a name for himself; Buckin' Billy Ray takes to the treetops of Vancouver Island, risking his life to keep other people safe.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Danny Pihl gambles on horsepower.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Rygaard Logging fights to fix a crooked skyline, crossing a deep valley on their longest road yet.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: A breakdown forces Jason Rygaard to choose between his crew's safety and finishing the job; Frank Harkness is caught in a whiteout while moving the excavator on a narrow mountainside logging road.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Danny Pihl relies on the experience of veteran cutters Dwayne and Chuck to take down massive old-growth trees; Craig Rygaard discovers son Jason made a catastrophic and costly miscalculation; Frank Harkness races to transport $100,000 worth of logs.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: In Alaska, a family emergency takes Mark from the yarder seat with no time for a shutdown.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Jason Rygaard fights the weather while hauling heavy, slick trees on the steepest setting of the season; Danny Pihl and his veteran crew precisely drop 250-foot, old-growth cedars next to a group of cabins.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Jason Rygaard races to clear a hillside in time to fill four logging trucks; Jay R Harkness fights to control the untethered Tigercat on a steep, snow-covered mountainside; Bucking Billy and his son Hogan battle a forest of hang-ups and widow-makers.

programme.desc: Mike and Robbie are trying to tackle a trio of vintage Fords but their sibling rivalry threatens to blow up the deal.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Honoring their late father and his massive stockpile of rusty gold, two sisters in Upstate New York invite the guys to pick through Dad's epic untouched garage.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: From a storied boatyard in the Bronx to an untouched 1970s mancave in Oregon, the guys tackle two mind-blowing bicoastal picks.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: At an historic Oregon flour mill, the guys tour the site of a massive restoration project and pick up some awesome items that will help in the rebuilding.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: An old walnut farm in California has barns that have not seen the light of day in years and just might contain the Holy Grail of vintage workwear.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: It's tattoo mania in New York as Mike and Danielle pick through an artist's high-end collection of flash art; in Ohio, Frank and Robbie bumble through four stories of junk in search of hidden treasures.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: In rural New York, the guys dive into back-to-back epic picks where the incredible collections tell the story of America.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Robbie are trying to tackle a trio of vintage Fords but their sibling rivalry threatens to blow up the deal.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Honoring their late father and his massive stockpile of rusty gold, two sisters in Upstate New York invite the guys to pick through Dad's epic untouched garage.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: From a storied boatyard in the Bronx to an untouched 1970s mancave in Oregon, the guys tackle two mind-blowing bicoastal picks.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Spencer drops into the shop with some tasty new finds, but will Rick bite? Then, Chum and Rick disappear from the shop to meet up with a magician selling a zig zag box. Can they conjure up an offer? Meanwhile, Corey finds himself flustered over a pricey gold necklace made of ancient coins. And later, Chum tries to script the perfect deal for a collection of Hollywood items.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A seller brings in a WWF prototype figurine; Rick takes a stab at a 19th century knife pistol; Corey attempts to smoke out a deal on a lighter from Frank Sinatra's hotel; Chum finds an original 1965 A Charlie Brown Christmas soundtrack album.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: When Rick reels in an antique glass fishing buoy made in Japan, he hopes the seller's price floats his boat; Chum checks out a rare dinosaur fossil; a customer brings in an original poster for the film "Where the Buffalo Roam."

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After a big order comes in Willie pushes the Duck Commander team to meet the tight deadline, so Jase and the warehouse guys come up with a plan to build a conveyer belt.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Brotherly competition gets the best of Willie when he ditches his kids' career day to go play golf with Jase. Stepping in for Willie, Phil and Si show up at the school and become the teachers' worst nightmare.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After blowing up one of Phil's dangerously antiquated duck blinds, the Robertson boys hatch a wild plan to build a luxury duck blind in the sky. Meanwhile, Ms. Kay and the Robertson women hold a yard sale.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jase feels being COO of Duck Commander entitles him to a new office. But when Willie refuses, Jase hatches a plan to build one anyhow. Willie takes Miss Kay and the grandkids to the petting zoo.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: It's duck blind maintenance time again and the boys have discovered the waterline is low. At the levee, they realize this is the work of Phil's bucktoothed arch nemesis...THE BEAVER.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: To prove once and for all who rules the river AND the boardroom, Willie and Jase revive their childhood rivalry and go head-to-head in a fishing competition with the added challenge of having to sell their catch.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: It's the 40-year anniversary of Duck Commander and this celebration is a redneck Robertson style shindig. To top off the event, Willie decides to construct the world's largest duck call to be revealed at the party.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jumping Asian carp have invaded Monroe's waters so Jase and the guys set out to try to stop them from spreading further. Meanwhile, Willie and Si have to run Willie's Duck Diner for the day.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The family spends a weekend at their childhood summer camp, reliving old memories and working to repair a tennis court Willie built twenty years ago. While at the camp, Jep tries to pass a lifeguard swimming test he failed as a teenager.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Rowdy's adoption is finalized and he officially becomes a Robertson. Jase gets his first massage and enjoys it more than he expected.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: While out duck hunting, Willie, Jase, and Uncle Si stumble across what redneck's consider nature's most prized succulent treasure--a beehive dripping with wild honey.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Willie finds out that his daughter Sadie has a new boyfriend, he wants to get to know him, while instilling some fatherly fear--Robertson style.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie decides to expand the Duck Commander brand into the winemaking industry and buys a vineyard...sight unseen.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jase volunteers to take the Duck Commander RV out on pick up, but neglects to mention to Willie, he's taking Si, Martin and Jep along for a road trip.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jase and Si embark on a turkey hunt for the annual Robertson men vs. Robertson women cook-off to create a feast of fresh wild game. With Phil's discerning palate as judge, the teams pull out all of the stops.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When a big business decision must be made affecting Duck Commander, Willie plans an employee retreat.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: It's all hands on deck for the Duckmen when an old high school nemesis challenges them to a good old fashion race... at the local lawn mower competition. But Willie and the guys soon find out that this sport is nothing short of high octane.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: With Sadie's (Willie's daughter) driver's license test fast approaching, she finds herself in dire need of lessons.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After Willie's son (John Luke) leaves Willie's pickup in the driveway with a bone-dry gas tank, Willie and Korie decide that it's time to get the kid his own car.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The Duck Commander assembly room gets an unexpected shakeup when a disgruntled Si decides to quit his job. But when Willie hires a replacement that clashes with the duck call room, Jase and the guys quickly become equally miserable at work. Meanwhile, Si turns to Phil for work out on the land turning a routine levee repair into a complete disaster.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie finds his office in shambles and alerts the authorities that the warehouse has had a break in. But soon Willie discovers that the culprit was his brother Jase, who needed supplies for an early morning frog hunt.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When a heat wave envelops West Monroe the air conditioning unit at the Duck Commander warehouse goes down, turning the duck call assembly room into a boiling sweatshop.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After attending a local radio show as a guest, Willie sees an opportunity to host a show of his own. When the station gives him the opportunity, Willie makes the mistake of bringing Uncle Si on the air with him.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After Korie decides the junk piles in the Duck Commander warehouse are beginning to reach critical mass, she calls on Willie and the guys to do a little company spring-cleaning. But the discovery of an old Ping-Pong table deep within the clutter quickly turns the chore into an all day table tennis tournament. Meanwhile, Uncle Si realizes that he's many years overdue for an appointment with the local eye doctor and ventures out for some new glasses.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: It's week two on the frozen tundra and the name of the game is Rig Move. MGM is breaking down camp and moving every last piece of equipment to a new base at Langley.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: After the storm clears, most of the truckers are ready to roll--all except Rick, who is on the verge of quitting and looks to Hugh for advice.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: It's day 53 of the ice road season and only the toughest truckers remain on a road that's sent many people packing.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: Spring brings a rush of warm weather and the big melt begins. The road is nearly empty as only the toughest or craziest truckers remain.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: It is a job only a few would dare. This year, four ice road truckers, Hugh, Alex, Rick and Drew, return from last season to join Arctic veterans.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: After just two days in the Arctic, the critical demands of the oil exploration sites are testing the limits of the truckers and their machines.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog is back in Denver and in hot pursuit of a woman wanted for identity theft. The sad reality is that the identify which has been robbed is her own. She's traded in a bright future for a life on the wrong side of the law.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Today Dog and the family are back in Colorado and are about to make one of their most exciting captures ever. On his search he'll encounter a felon with history of violence and an alleged affection for sawed-off shotguns.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: It's been quite a while since Tim Chapman put down his mace can and bulletproof vest to care for his growing family. When his old friend Dog calls asking for help tracking an elusive felon Tim jumps into action.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: What's a father to do? When the cops ask Dog for help tracking down a renegade teen with a history of running hard, Baby Lyssa, eight months pregnant and counting, insists on joins the hunt.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Upset because one his puppies may die and wanting to give the little guy a second chance in life, Dog decides to offer one of the fugitives a second chance, too.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Once a criminal himself, Dog knows how it feels to be hunted. In this episode of our series that focuses on the tumultuous home and professional life of bounty hunter Dwayne "Dog" Chapman.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Working for a bondswoman friend, Mary Ellen, Dog and his team hunt Chris, a fugitive wanted on drug charges. Dog turns over every rock, but to no avail.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog, taking the day off to try his hand at coaching, assigns Tim and Leland to track down Emmanuel, a fugitive with terminal cancer who's got nothing to lose by running. Can the boys prove to Dog and Beth that they can handle a difficult job on their own?

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Hunting down a fugitive known as "Bozo," Dog gets help from an unexpected source - Bozo's father-in-law. When they find Bozo, he protests his wife-beating charge, saying he never hit her with his fist, only his open hand.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Before Tim heads out for a tough day of bounty hunting, he likes to get in a little quality time with his daughter, Summer Rain. This morning, he takes the toddler for a spin around the yard in her little red wagon.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Baby Lyssa, who's just turned 18 and is studying to become a bondsman, gets to do some on-the-job training when she helps Dog hunt for Wayne, who's run out on a bond for second-degree assault.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: It's the day before Valentine's Day and love is in the air at Da Kine Bail Bonds--but not for Tapi who has failed to appear in court on theft charges. Dog's plan is to have Leland knock on Tapi's door with a Valentine's gift to draw her out.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Tim's got a big problem on his hands. One of his clients, Owen, has failed to appear in court. He's on bond for serious drug charges and now Tim could lose $30,000 if he doesn't catch Owen.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: As Dog likes to say, "it's not the years it's the miles," and this goes for both men and machines. Those long hunts and the rides to jail take a toll not only on Dog but also on his vehicles.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Roger has 27 prior arrests, spent years in jail and doesn't want to go back. But he's missed court and now Dog has to bring him in.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog told him not to go, but Charles went anyway, skipping to Oregon against the terms of his bail. Now Dog has a tip that Charles plans to slip back into Honolulu. With $30,000 on the line Dog knows he can leave little to chance.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Today the crew is hunting for Holly, a car thief. She's one of Tim's bonds and the entire Dog crew knows that means trouble--or at least a long and difficult chase.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Being hunted by the Dog is a lousy way to celebrate your birthday but that's exactly the spot that Robert finds himself in today. He's missed his court date, quit his job, and vacated his last known address.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog always wants to share the wisdom he has collected on the streets with the fugitives he captures. But today he's going to do double duty! His son-in-law Travis (and trainee bondsman) is also in need of some knowledge.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Today the team isn't pulling any punches, literally or figuratively! In between tracking down a potentially dangerous ex-con facing a five year stretch in the big house, Leland is struggling to find time to train.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog knows that it is better to give than to receive, so when a fellow bondsman grieving for his recently departed spouse requests his help, he jumps into action. Studying the fugitive's file the team uncovers a surprising fact.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: When a stripper goes on the lam, Dog has to bring her in--it's a tough job but somebody has to do it. Thankfully for the team, Lady Luck is presiding over the posse tonight.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: The "Big Island" of Hawaii boasts both lush tropical splendor and stark volcanic beauty. But today Dog and the team can't spend much time taking in the sights, they need to help Leland hunt down some elusive fugitives.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and Beth take time from their busy schedule to thank their fans by inviting them into their home to celebrate the holiday season. But when Dog decides he needs to help his son Garry believe in Santa Claus again the plan changes.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog doesn't have the whole team today and he's got to catch a fugitive with a record of criminal assault. But when Dog finds the fugitive's former girlfriend, she thinks he isn't dangerous at all.
